definition: independent/self-reliant/self-sustaining/to stand on one's own feet/to support oneself
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself

sentences.english: Women of middle and lower classer have been laboring in different trades and seeking for economic independence.
sentences.chinese: 中下层女子从事各种行业的劳动，谋求经济自立。

sentences.english: Following Afghan tradition, local commanders are building independent fiefs that they will be reluctant to relinquish.
sentences.chinese: 按照阿富汗的传统，当地的指挥官都愿意自立王国。

sentences.english: In the household, young kids are imbued with concept of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭中，孩子从小就被灌输自立自强的观念。

sentences.english: Check via the platoon, police was carried out independently to another suspect land capture.
sentences.chinese: 经排查，警方对另一嫌疑人陆自立实施了抓捕。

sentences.english: Enter that paragon of self-reliance, the entrepreneur.
sentences.chinese: 企业家毫无疑问是自立的典范。

sentences.english: Remember that God sets us to our (His) tasks, and we dare not presume to arrogate any tasks to ourselves apart from Him.
sentences.chinese: 记住是神给我们分配任务，我们怎敢离开神自立门户。

sentences.english: Projects which create forks should be thinking about merging back from the outset.
sentences.chinese: 自立门户的项目也应该想着要合并回去。

sentences.english: One of the big assumptions brought into this debate is that forking is a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 这场讨论的一个重大假设是，自立门户是一件坏事。

sentences.english: But sometimes you must let them stand alone to see if they are strong enough.
sentences.chinese: 但有时，你必须让他们自立，看他们是否足够强壮。

sentences.english: I tried to stand on my own two rather than turned to my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我设法自立儿不求助于斡的父母。

sentences.english: "Unless above himself he can Erect himself, how poor a thing  is man"--DANIEL.
sentences.chinese: 一个人唯有超越自我才能自立，否则那是多么可怜。

sentences.english: Year in October, immediately forced the Han Xiandi abdicate the throne, self-reliance for the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 当年十月，立刻逼迫汉献帝禅位，自立为皇帝。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, successful self-directed learners know how to be self-reliant.
sentences.chinese: 然而，成功的自主学者了解如何自立。

sentences.english: Only self confidence, you can pay the bill of life.
sentences.chinese: 只有自强自立自信，你才能付得起人生的账单。

sentences.english: Eg: We stor further for strengthening self-reliance and cooperinethe underlying developing countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们支持发展中国度的自立与协作。

definition: independent and autonomous (idiom); self-determination/to act independently/to maintain control over one's own affairs
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
to preserve the accomplishments of previous generations/to carry on the good work of one's predecessors
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
